nodes.text: node
Add 2µl lysis buffer mix to each well. Cover with appropriate lids. Spin down.
Multiplets can be discerned from singlets by gating on the basis of FSC-W (Forward scatter - Width) and FSC-H (Forward scatter - Height)
Thaw plate and spin down briefl y. Incubate in thermocycler at 72°C for 3 min to anneal primers. Place on ice immediately.
node
Dispense 3µl per well, cover plate with new fi lm and spin down.
node
node
Dispense 7.5 µl per well. Total reaction volume will be 12.5µl. Spin down and cover with new lid.
node
cDNA cleanup
Using 20% SPRI-bead solution. Add 0.7x the reaction volume of SPRI beads per well,Mix well by pipetting
Incubate 5 min. Room temperature
Place on magnetic stand for 3 min
Carefully remove supernatant
Add 40 µl 80% EtOH and incubate 30 sec
Remove EtOH (without disturbing the beads)
Wash again with EtOH. Make sure to remove as much ethanol as possible.
Wash again with EtOH. Make sure to remove as much ethanol as possible.
Remove plate from magnetic stand
Elute beads in 15 µl EB or TE buffer. Mix well by pipetting
Incubate 5 min. Room temperature
Place on magnetic plate for 3 min
cDNA quantification
Add 97 µl of 1X Qubit HS dsDNA solution to a fl at-bottom, black plate
Add 3 µl of cDNA sample
Add Standards
Read in plate reader using 485nM excitation/528nm emission
Calculate average well cDNA concentration for single cells and multiplets respectively
Dilute cDNA in water based on average concentration from Qubit measurements. Target concentration is 150pg/µl per well.
Tn5 digestion
node
Dispense 1.8 µl per well in a new plate (tagmentation plate).
Add 0.7 µl cDNA (normalized to 150pg/µl) to tagmentation plate
Cover with new lid, mix well by vortexing plate and spin down
Incubate in thermocycler at 55°C for 10 min
Remove immediately and stop the reaction by adding 1µl of 0.1% SDS per well.
Vortex, spin down and incubate 7 min. at Room temperature
cDNA library PCR and barcoding
node
Dispense 19.5 µl per well to tagmentation plate (containing 3.5 µl sample after step 9)
Add primers/barcodes: Dispense 2 µl per well (from 384-well index plates, with 3.75µM/each forward/reverse primers)
Total reaction volume is 25 µl (3.5 µl sample + 19.5 µl PCR mix and 2 µl primers).Cover, vortex and spin down
node
Following barcoding, pool 2.5µl from each well to an 1.5ml Eppendorf tube
Library cleanup
Add 0.9x pooled library volume of SPRI-bead solution. Incubate for 5 min. at room temperature
Place on magnetic rack for 3 min
Remove supernatant without disturbing magnetic beads.
Add at least 1 mL 80% EtOH (fresh). Incubate for 30 sec
Remove supernatant
Repeat EtOH wash
Air dry for 10 - 15 min
Re-suspend beads thoroughly in 100 µl EB or TE buffer.
Place eppendorf on magnetic rack for 3 min.
Transfer supernatant to new 1.5ml Eppendorf tube.
Repeat cleanup  and elute in 30µl EB or TE buffer
